title.narrative: Design and delivery of a national cloud and fibre optic cable infrastructure

description.narrative: Burkina Faso has embarked on a policy of reforms aiming at the use of information and communications technology (ICT) to promote the empowerment of the citizens and economic growth. The reforms are aiming at making ICT broadly available and promote its use in society as part of a drive to combat corruption, modernise the public administration and strengthen democracy, decentralisation and the respect and fulfilment of human rights. The project will put in place favourable conditions for the introduction of e-government solutions. It includes 1) a 513 km metropolitan optical fibre network connecting the 13 largest municipalities with the nationwide backbone network and connecting more than 400 public and industrial buildings, 2) a government cloud platform composed of servers as well as all necessary programming software and enabler applications in order for the different public organisations to develop specific applications for the e-services, and 3) 741 km inter-urban optical fibres to strengthen the backbone.
